doc.previous: On July 14, 2009, House Democratic leaders introduced a 1,017-page plan for overhauling the U.S. health care system, which Obama wanted Congress to approve by the end of 2009.[213] After much public debate during the Congressional summer recess of 2009, Obama delivered a speech to a joint session of Congress on September 9 where he addressed concerns over the proposals.[216] In March 2009, Obama lifted a ban on using federal funds for stem cell research.[217]
doc.after: On November 7, 2009, a health care bill featuring the public option was passed in the House.[219][220] On December 24, 2009, the Senate passed its own billâwithout a public optionâon a party-line vote of 60â39.[221] On March 21, 2010, the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (ACA) passed by the Senate in December was passed in the House by a vote of 219 to 212.[222] Obama signed the bill into law on March 23, 2010.[223]
